description: This file defines a base class 'DockerResource' for managing Docker resources, including methods for reading, creating, updating, and deleting resources via a Docker API client. It also includes mechanisms for caching and conditional operations, serving as a foundational class for Docker resource management in the project.

classes.name: DockerResource
classes.description: Base class for Docker resources, providing common methods for resource lifecycle management such as read, create, update, delete, and their post-operation hooks.

methods.name: get_from_cluster
methods.description: Static method to retrieve all resources of this type from the Docker cluster; currently not implemented.

methods.name: get_docker_client
methods.description: Returns the DockerApiClient instance, creating one if not already set.

methods.name: _read
methods.description: Placeholder method for reading resource details; meant to be overridden.

methods.name: read
methods.description: Reads the resource from the Docker cluster, using cache if available.

methods.name: is_active
methods.description: Checks if the resource is active on the Docker cluster.

methods.name: _create
methods.description: Placeholder method for creating the resource; meant to be overridden.

methods.name: create
methods.description: Creates the resource on the Docker cluster, with caching and post-creation steps.

methods.name: post_create
methods.description: Hook for post-creation steps; default implementation returns True.

methods.name: _update
methods.description: Placeholder method for updating the resource; meant to be overridden.

methods.name: update
methods.description: Updates the resource on the Docker cluster, with caching and post-update steps.

methods.name: post_update
methods.description: Hook for post-update steps; default implementation returns True.

methods.name: _delete
methods.description: Placeholder method for deleting the resource; meant to be overridden.

methods.name: delete
methods.description: Deletes the resource from the Docker cluster, with post-deletion steps.

methods.name: post_delete
methods.description: Hook for post-deletion steps; default implementation returns True.
